intro: Sisyrinchium idahoense var. birameum, commonly known as the Idaho basket flower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has slender, hairy stems and linear, grass-like leaves. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
